a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:21): hrm
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:21): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: know anyone who knows stuff about css font things?
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:21): spec things
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:21): elaborate?
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:22): well, for example, opentype doesn't really define font weights very well aside from giving 100-900 names
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:22): there are a bunch of fonts with weights of say 950 or 1000
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:22): (not many with 1000, but a few.  quite a few 950s)
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:23): (and i've seen other x50 ones)
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:24): just trying to understand what the best thing to do is/if the spec should change

a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:25): like, if i have a 900 and a 1000, i should probably ignore the 1000 (or use it/support it?) but if i don't have a 900 i should probably round the 950/1000 down
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:26): if i have 100, 150, 200, 250, 300, ... 950 should i support them all? bolder/lighter do what?

5d5b78699e57104f2fa03bbdf7b9197b (07:30): by gsnedders on Tue Dec 18 21:41:19
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:31): imho, supporting more than that is feasable

a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:31): like, the spec says "If the font family already uses a numerical scale with nine values (like e.g. OpenType does), the font weights should be mapped directly."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:32): yeah if you have more than 2 weight above bold (700) then the spec just says to drop some
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:32): except that OpenType doesn't specify just 9 steps
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:32): well, 9 weight is probably enough for now -- most pages don't bother with more than 2 levels anyway
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:32): yeah
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:33): 1000 is pretty rare
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:33): if there really are fonts that have more weights, i would invent keywords -moz-1000, -moz-1100, etc
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:33): think i've seen 2 fonts with it?
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:33): 950 is pretty common thouhg
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:33): so i would say map the boldest one to 900
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:33): map the main bold one to 700
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:33): and if there are any between those to, map the middle one of those to 800
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:34): which direction would you map x50s to if you don't have an exact number for it?
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:34): like, say you have 100, 250, 400
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:35): maybe you map both 200 and 300 to that
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:35): if you have 100, 200, 350, 400, i guess you could round 350 down
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:36): and if you have 100, 200, 300, 350, 400, just skip 350?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:36): map the main medium weight to 400
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:36): map the lightest one to 100
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:37): i'm saying if i have 5 opentype fonts of the same family that have all 5 of those weights
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:37): or 3 or 4 of them
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:37): then just drop one
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:37): what should I do with x50 weights?
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:37): what i suggested?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:38): so, map the main medium weight to 400, the lightest one to 100, and for 200 and 300 just pick some that are equidistant from lightest to medium
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:38): soif you just have one extra, just drop one of them, doesn't matter which
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:38): i wouldn't map the opentype numbers straight to the 100-900 numbers like the spec says, if you have any x50 weights
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:39): well, there is no other concept of "main medium weight" face
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:39): you either have 400 or you don't
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:40): many bold faces if you treat them as a family only have a 700 weight

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:40): i'd just sort them per weight, pin 100, 400 (the "regular" weight), 700 ("bold"), and 900, and fill the others in a linear way so that they are distributed uniformly
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:40): k
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:40): well if you have fewer weights, the spec defines how you fill things in
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:40): right
a6b80daf336e58aacd97cfab4d064aba (07:40): fewer isn't the problem as much
